headline: Why Morgan Stanley, Citi and other banks are exiting climate alliance
summary: Morgan Stanley (MS), Citigroup (C), Bank of America (BAC), Goldman Sachs (GS), and Wells Fargo (WFC) are among the major banks that left the Net Zero Banking Alliance (NZBA). Yahoo Finance's Banking Reporter David Hollerith joins Asking for a Trend with Josh Lipton to break down what it means for the banking sector heading into a second Trump administration. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Wall Street banks exit climate alliance as Trump 2.0 nears
summary: Some of the biggest lenders in the US are beating a retreat from a UN-backed bank climate group in the final weeks before a new Trump administration prepares to take office.

raw.headline: Wall Street banks exit climate alliance as Trump 2.0 nears

headline: Citigroup: Still Banking On Its Discount
summary: Citigroup's stock has outperformed the S&P 500 and analysts predict additional gains ahead, despite mixed financials. See why we believe C stock is a buy.
